DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Treatment Arm Clinical Complete Response Or Clinical Benefit Outcome Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine where a specific treatment plan within a clinical trial resulted in either the disappearance of all signs of cancer based on physical exam or in an effect of a therapeutic intervention that prolongs life, improves function, and/or improves the way a subject feels.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol Treatment Arm Clinical Complete Response Or Clinical Benefit Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A specific treatment plan within a clinical trial that describes the activities a subject will be involved in as he or she progresses through the study._The disappearance of all signs of cancer based on physical exam, such as palpation._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._An effect of a therapeutic intervention that prolongs life, improves function, and/or improves the way a subject feels._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A specific treatment protocol used in a clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A specific treatment plan within a clinical trial that describes the activities a subject will be involved in as he or she progresses through the study.

Property.preferredName: Clinical Complete Response Or Clinical Benefit Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer based on physical exam, such as palpation.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:An effect of a therapeutic intervention that prolongs life, improves function, and/or improves the way a subject feels.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer based on physical exam, such as palpation.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
An effect of a therapeutic intervention that prolongs life, improves function, and/or improves the way a subject feels.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
